register.name: BT_DCRS_EQ_PWR_STATUS_AT_SYNC
register.comment: This is not exactly EqPwr registered at Sync. It is the post-digital gain signal power averaged over the longer period of time used for BbPwr. In order to measure this, we use BbPwr and compensate for the digital gain at Sync. This results in a stabilised RSSI value after digital gain. It also produces a 16-bit result which the XAP can more easily manage than the raw BBPwrAtSync (32 bit)Measured baseband power (post-digital gain) obtained at RxSync, averaged over the longer period of time used for pre-digital gain measurements.

block.name: wlrf_radio
block.comment: Wireless LAN radio control analogue registers

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_LNA_RSSI_THRESH_EXT_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the LNA RSSI module, turning off external LNA indication

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_LNA_RSSI_THRESH_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the LNA RSSI module, too loud indication (- 6dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_LNA_RSSI_THRESH_V_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the LNA RSSI module, extra loud indication (-12dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_MIX_RSSI_THRESH_WEAK
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the Mixer RSSI module, too weak indication (+ 6dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_MIX_RSSI_THRESH_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the Mixer RSSI module, too loud indication (- 6dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_MIX_RSSI_THRESH_V_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the Mixer RSSI module, extra loud indication (-12dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_ABB_RSSI_THRESH_WEAK
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the ABB RSSI module, too weak indication (+ 1.5dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_ABB_RSSI_THRESH_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the ABB RSSI module, too loud indication (- 6dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_ABB_RSSI_THRESH_V_LOUD
register.comment: This register specifies the threshold value for the ABB RSSI module, extra loud indication (-12dB gain change request)

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_RX_RSSI
register.comment: This register contains the RSSI of the receive chain. The lower byte is the 8 bit digital RSSI (fixed to 0 since this is a radio-only chip) and the upper byte is the final analogue gain in 3dB steps.

register.name: WLRF_RSSI_FILTERED_STATUS
register.comment: This register contains the analogue RSSI values for the receive chain, after initial processing in the rssi blocks block.

register.name: WLRF_WB_RSSI_LUT0
register.comment: First 6 locations of LUT used to generate RSSI values for WB RSSI. Note that fields are 5 bits but only LS 4 bits are used

register.name: WLRF_WB_RSSI_LUT1
register.comment: Last 6 locations of LUT used to generate RSSI values for WB RSSI. Note that fields are 5 bits but only LS 4 bits are used

register.name: WLRF_IB_RSSI_LUT0
register.comment: First 6 locations of LUT used to generate RSSI values for IB RSSI

register.name: WLRF_IB_RSSI_LUT1
register.comment: Last 6 locations of LUT used to generate RSSI values for IB RSSI

register.name: WLRF_ABB_RSSI_LUT0
register.comment: First 6 locations of LUT used to generate RSSI values for ABB RSSI

register.name: WLRF_ABB_RSSI_LUT1
register.comment: Last 6 locations of LUT used to generate RSSI values for ABB RSSI

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG1
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits for the AGC as follows:

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG2
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: gains ranges definition. valid when AGC is active, and gain not forced.

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_RX_LEVEL
register.comment: This register contains the value to be sent to the analogue gain stages if the AGC is disabled.

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_GAIN_STATUS
register.comment: This register contains the current gain settings to all blocks in the analogue front end

register.name: WLRF_ANA_LNA_TRIM_LUT
register.comment: This register defines the LUT used to generate ZIN_TRIM values for 2G5 LNAs

register.name: WLRF_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: Selects which debug appears on the output of the WLAN block

register.name: WLRF_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Returns the current value on the debug bus

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_CONFIG
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_TEMP_CTRL_CONFIG
register.comment: Control register for block interfacing to analogue temperature sensor

register.name: WLRF_ANA_INT_CFG
register.comment: Configure source for WL status interrupts

register.name: WLRF_ANA_INT_STATUS
register.comment: WL Status Interrupt status

register.name: WLRF_ANA_RAW_INT_STATUS
register.comment: Raw status from the analogue module - intended for hardware debug

register.name: WLRF_RADIO_TEMP
register.comment: Radio temperature, as measured by analogue sensors near PA

register.name: WLRF_ANA_STATUS
register.comment: Returns the value on the ANA_STATUS bus

register.name: WLRF_ANA_RSSI_STATUS
register.comment: This register contains the raw analogue RSSI values for the receive chain

register.name: WLRF_ANA_ENABLES_STATUS
register.comment: This register contains the current values of the Analogue Enables, after all masking and multiplexing.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_ENABLES
register.comment: Default values for analogue enables signals should the mask register select this rather than the timer outputs

register.name: WLRF_ANA_ENABLES_MASK
register.comment: Selects use of ANA_ENABLES or timer outputs. A 1 in a given bit selects the timer output.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TRAINING_ENABLES_MASK
register.comment: This masks the output of the Tx timer when it is not a DPD training frame. The idea is to be able to remove the extra Rx enables that are required for making DPD training work to improve power consumption on frames that don't need them. It should typically have all the Tx bits set and none of the Rx bits.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT
register.comment: This register contains the current slot selected by the Tx timer

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT
register.comment: This register contains the current slot selected by the Rx timer

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TRIM_TX
register.comment: This register sets the modulation dependent analogue trims in low power mode and when Ana Tx Test Mode is selected (in WLRF_RADIO_CONFIG register)

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TX_CCK_TRIM_CONF
register.comment: CCK modulation dependent analogue trims

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TX_OFDM0_TRIM_CONF
register.comment: OFDM modulation dependent analogue trims when corresponding bit in WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_ANA_OFDM_SEL is set to 0

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TX_OFDM1_TRIM_CONF
register.comment: OFDM modulation dependent analogue trims when corresponding bit in WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_ANA_OFDM_SEL is set to 1

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT0_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 0.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT1_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 1.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT2_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 2.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT3_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 3.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT4_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 4.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT5_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 5.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT6_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 6.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT7_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 7.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT0_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 0 becoming active in 50ns units

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT1_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 1 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT2_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 2 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT3_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 3 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT4_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 4 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT5_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 5 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT6_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 6 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT7_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 7 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_TX_SLOT_ON_OFF_LAST
register.comment: This register sets the start and end of Tx turn on and off ramps, and the slot jumped to in the case of a Tx abort

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT0_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for receive timer slot 0.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT1_ENABLES
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for receive timer slot 1.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT2_ENABLES

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT0_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 0 becoming active in 50ns units

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT1_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 1 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT2_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 2 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT3_DELAY

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT4_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 4 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT5_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 5 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT6_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 6 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_ANA_TIMER_RX_SLOT7_DELAY
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Rx timer enable to slot 7 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will wrap, allowing delays up to 12.8us to be selected.

register.name: WLRF_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Writing this register clears any interrupts whose corresponding bits are set in the write data. Bit allocations are as for WL_RF_INT_MASK

register.name: WLRF_INT_MASK
register.comment: This register masks events from causing interrupts. Only those interrupts whose mask bit is set will be delivered to the processors

register.name: WLRF_INT_STATUS
register.comment: This register has bits set in it for any interrupt that is currently active. In addition 'raw' bits are set for any active interrupt, whether it is masked or not

register.name: WL_ANA_ABB_DCOC_I_LUT

register.name: WL_ANA_ABB_DCOC_Q_LUT

register.name: WL_ANA_ABB_DCOC_LUT_STATUS
